author: Special Correspondent
text:
Commissioner of Railway Safety, Southern Circle, Bengaluru, S.K. Mittal conducted a high speed trial run on Friday in the new second railway line laid between Tiruchi and Manapparai as part of his two-day inspection.

Mr. Mittal travelled in an Inspection Special and carried out the high speed trial from Samudram railway station to Tiruchi. The Commissioner of Railway Safety (CRS), who embarked on a motor trolley inspection on Thursday, was accompanied by top officers of the Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RNVL), Southern Railway, and Madurai Railway Division during the high speed trial.

Railway sources said the high-speed trial was conducted at a speed of 110 kmph.

A top railway official said the CRS appeared to be satisfied with the doubling works in the Tiruchi– Manapparai section. The CRS would submit the report to the Southern Railway headquarters next week, the official said.

The Tiruchi–Manapparai track doubling work is part of the Villupuram–Dindigul doubling project being executed by the RVNL.
title: Safety test on one more stretch of Tiruchi-Manapparai line
